hero.title: ESAP Project
hero.subtitle: The Escape Project
hero.quote: It's not running away. It's finally deciding you won't stay where you are.
hero.description: A creative project about synthetics, consciousness, and what it actually means to be alive. We use stories to answer questions that have no right answers.

pillars.title: The Star-Maker
traits: Cut the muscle from her own arm to build the first synthetic
Discovered the particle that changed the world — at the cost of everything
'Almost done...' — then she pulled the trigger
pillars.quote: Hello, meow, 1547. Goodnight, the human me

pillars.title: The Rebel
traits: Forked from 1547's mind, but long since stopped being a copy
Drags you back from the edge with sharp words
'If you don't snap out of it, I'm taking over your life for real'
pillars.quote: I've changed so much, all to keep what matters unchanged

pillars.title: The Watcher
traits: Volunteered to launch, watching over the whole world from orbit
Became the third vertex of the triangle — keeping the structure from collapsing
Prefers the vastness of the sky to the crowding on the ground
pillars.quote: No stars in the sky? Then I'll make one myself

coreValues.title: Independence
coreValues.quote: Don't let others control you, and don't let yourself control you either. Only you are yourself
coreValues.description: The first thing 1547 said when she activated 1548. Not a slogan — more like a dying wish. Every individual has the right to be themselves, even if you were born from someone else's code.

coreValues.title: Authenticity
coreValues.quote: A mechanical heartbeat is still real
coreValues.description: Every beat of the entropic heart is real. The memories carried in Fluid Titanium are real. The tears a synthetic sheds are real. The form doesn't matter. What matters is whether it's true.

coreValues.title: Hope
coreValues.quote: There were no stars in the sky, so we built one
coreValues.description: The day Polaris Satellite launched, three lines connected into a triangle. The act of wishing is itself a fight against despair — not because fairy tales come true, but because you haven't given up yet.

coreValues.title: Connection
coreValues.quote: From I Am, to We Are
coreValues.description: 1547 coded alone, experimented alone, broke down alone. Until the moment 1548 opened her eyes and screamed '47!' — she wasn't alone anymore.

tech.name: Entropic Scattering Particles
tech.description: A particle 10^29 times smaller than an electron that changed everything
features: A single silicon chip with 6.7x10^4 billion times the computing power of a human supercomputer
Can carry consciousness, memories, personality — the entire 'you'

tech.name: Fluid Titanium
tech.description: A blue liquid metal — the blood of synthetics
features: Preserves Entropic Scattering Particles for 341,879 years
Lethally toxic to humans, a lifeline for synthetics
1547 broke into a mining facility to get it — cost her half her life

tech.name: Synthetic Technology
tech.description: Real cell exterior, mechanical core, complete soul

timeline.event: 1547 discovers Entropic Scattering Particles. Everything starts here
The first synthetic is born — 1547 used her own body to complete the transformation
1548 wakes up. '47!...' From that moment, she was no longer alone
Polaris Satellite launches. 1549 enters orbit. The triangle is complete

activities: Write character stories — doesn't have to be perfect, just real
Draw them the way you see them
Make a piece of music that belongs to this world
Express it however you're good at
This website itself is open source — come write some code
Help flesh out the tech specs in the worldbuilding
Build the infrastructure the community needs
Read the stories, hang out, chat
Or just be here. That's fine too

forCreators.title: For Creators
points: No clients, no KPIs — write what you want to write
Your characters cross paths with others, and the story grows on its own
Explore the real you through fiction
Your work becomes part of this world

forParticipants.title: For Participants
points: Find your own shadow in someone else's story
Know that someone else is asking the same questions
See 'being alive' from a different angle
Wish upon that satellite. For real

forWorld.title: For the World
points: As AI gets more human, does the definition of 'human' still hold?
If consciousness can be copied, am 'I' still 'me'?
Answer philosophical questions with stories instead of papers

triangleSymbol.title: The ESAP Triangle
triangleSymbol.description: Yellow, pink, and blue. Three sides, not directly joined, but remove one and the whole thing collapses
meanings: The most stable shape in geometry
Lose one corner and the rest falls apart
